body: Instead of introducing a patch into our repository, why not bumping `miniupnpc` sources as we have done for `libnatpmp` in #21209?

> why not bumping miniupnpc sources

I haven't tested them, and don't currently plan to. The 2.2.3 tag is also broken out of the box.

> why not bumping miniupnpc sources

There's also no release/tag that would include my patch. So are you suggesting we move to using the master branch of miniupnpc? I doubt that is good idea, or would be sources that are particularly well tested. The only reason we do that for libnatpmp is because the author hasn't made a release in 7 years.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22644](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22644) (Deprecate UPnP support, require 2.1 or later by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

[`f1d031df3fcd1971...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/ceac1a5ef39baa530adf629a18059b23e1c17366/guix_build.log.diff) |

Does this actually work?

`Makefile.mingw` defines `_WIN32_WINNT` in CPPFLAGS, which it puts on the commandline after CFLAGS, so I would expect it to override whatever we put in CFLAGS here...

> Does this actually work?

Yes.

`make -C depends/ HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 -j9 miniupnpc V=1`.

master (a9049dd296a47319038d8c34bcc1ca46c89dee9c):
```bash
x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -Wall -W -Wstrict-prototypes -Os -DNDEBUG -D_WIN32_WINNT=0X501 -DMINIUPNP_STATICLIB -c -o upnpcommands.o upnpcommands.c
```

This PR (1a332c78dbc78a8fd941289c21e662b10bd3b914):
```bash
x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc -pipe -std=c11 -O2 -D_WIN32_WINNT=0x0601 -DMINIUPNP_STATICLIB -c -o upnpcommands.o upnpcommands.c
```
Ah, apparently this part has changed in master miniupnpc. Maybe add a comment or assert-like check to ensure we don't bump it without fixing?
I've added a comment for the next update.
